intro: Terpsichore david-smithii, commonly known as the David-Smith's terpsichore, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of tubular and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with a delicate appearance that adds to its ornamental value. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
